de.hshl.obj.loader.objects

Class SurfaceObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hshl.obj.meta.Reflective.DataClass
      • de.hshl.obj.loader.objects.SurfaceObject

  • public final class SurfaceObject
extends Reflective.DataClass
    Represents an object or a group from an OBJ file. Contains a name and a list of Surfaces. For each section of geometry with a different Material in the group or object, a separate Surface exists. Also provides functionality to create SurfaceObjects from raw OBJ data.
    Author:
    Johannes Vollmer
    See Also:
    getSurfaces(), getName()

    • Constructor Summary

      SurfaceObject(java.lang.String name, java.util.List<Surface> surfaces)

      Take all objects or groups from the OBJ data and create a list of SurfaceObjects from it.
      java.lang.String getName()
      The name this object or group was called in the OBJ file
      java.util.List<Surface> getSurfaces()
      The OBJ data is split to create a separate Surface for each material in this object.

    • Method Detail

      • extract

        public static java.util.List<SurfaceObject> extract(TriangularOBJBuilder obj,
                                                    boolean useGroupsInstead,
                                                    boolean indexing)
        Take all objects or groups from the OBJ data and create a list of SurfaceObjects from it. Will ignore any geometry which does not belong to any object or group. Note that the geometry of each object will be split where the material is switched.
        Parameters:
        obj - Source data
        useGroupsInstead - Whether to extract OBJ objects or OBJ groups
        indexing - Whether to produce indexed meshes
        Returns:
        All SurfaceObjects from the source data

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        The name this object or group was called in the OBJ file

      • getSurfaces

        public java.util.List<Surface> getSurfaces()
        The OBJ data is split to create a separate Surface for each material in this object.
